title: Terahertz Topological Insulators: Breaking Barriers for Future On-Chip Wireless Communication
authors: Maryam Khodadadi, Gabriele Gradoni, Mohsen Khalily
summary: PTIs offer a transformative approach to THz on-chip communication, enabling backscatter-free signal transport with intrinsic robustness. They address scalability and performance limitations of conventional platforms.
key_points: Intrinsic robustness to fabrication imperfections
Low-loss routing and thermally optimized transmission
Scalable and low-cost deployment for adaptive NoC architectures

title: Impact of Atmospheric Gases on Terahertz Channel Propagation for 6G Wireless Networks
authors: Chilakala Sudhamani, Mardeni Roslee, Idris Olalekan Adeoye, Azmi Ismail, Yasir Ullah, Fardin Kabir
summary: This paper investigates the impact of atmospheric gases on Terahertz (THz) channel performance, using simulation results to compare three path models: Close-In (CI), Close-In Frequency (CIF), and Alpha-Beta-Gamma (ABG). The study finds that atmosp...
key_points: Atmospheric gases impact THz channel performance
CI and CIF models show higher path loss than ABG model
THz channel propagation is influenced by dry air and water vapor

title: Review on 6G Wireless Communication
authors: Bharti Parmar, Rahul Kumar Chaurasiya, Mohit Choubey
summary: The article discusses the capabilities of 6G communication technology, which will integrate machine learning and AI to improve urban living experiences, address environmental challenges, and provide efficient solutions across industries.
key_points: Faster data rates exceeding 100 GB/s
High-quality imaging and precise localization
Advanced sensing and smart city applications

title: AI-Augmented Cybersecurity Protocols for Secure Multi-Hop Wireless Communication in 6G Networks
authors: Keshav Kaushik, Renu Kumawat, Deepak Kejriwal, Shubhi Gupta, Anil Kumar, Swarnima Gupta
summary: The article proposes a holistic AI-augmented cybersecurity protocol for 6G networks, combining Deep Learning, Federated Learning, and Reinforcement Learning to ensure secure multi-hop wireless communication.
key_points: AI-driven threat detection
Flexible security control management
Improved performance in detection accuracy and latency
Cost-effective resource utilization
Holistic solution for future wireless systems

title: mmWave Dual-Coverage RIS-Aided 6G Wireless Communications: Experimental Demonstration
authors: Randy Verdecia-Peña, Daniel Martinez-de-Rioja, José I. Alonso, Eduardo Carrasco
summary: Researchers integrated a 27 GHz millimeter wave reconfigurable intelligent surface (RIS) into a custom-built 5G NR platform, demonstrating significant improvements in key performance indicators for 6G communication.
key_points: Dual-coverage RIS design
Improved RSRP, SINR, and EVM
Field measurements compared to end-to-end mmWave scenarios
27 GHz frequency band used
Enhanced mmWave 6G communication reliability

title: Key Technologies and Spectrum-Efficient Utilization for 6G Terahertz Communications
summary: This paper investigates the terahertz band (0.1–10T Hz) for 6G, focusing on technical bottlenecks and proposing an optimization framework for high-frequency communication.
key_points: Severe propagation losses in terahertz
Complex channel modeling and hardware implementation
Dynamic spectrum allocation and intelligent modulation-coding schemes

title: Impact of Rain Attenuation on the Performance of 6G Terahertz Communication System
summary: This article analyzes the effect of rain on THz communication systems using QPSK modulation, highlighting key factors influencing Bit Error Rate (BER).
key_points: Rain attenuation affects THz link reliability
Frequency-dependent decay is considered using Mie theory
Wide aperture and proper frequency selection reduce BER degradation

title: Design and Analysis of THz Antenna for 6G Applications Using CSRR-Based Technology to Enhance Return Loss and Gain in HFSS
authors: N. Srinivasulu, T. Vineeth Yadav, S. Venkata Sai Hemanth, R. Vishnu Priya, T. Udhay Kumar
